Zinzy Waleson Geene
Yes, and —

I'm a researcher, designer, and mentor from Amsterdam making tools and services for people at work.

Feb 12, 2023

She blesses Anja, me, and a handful of other people who carved out time in their Sunday evenings to come to Church. I have never been inside this particular church building before, and chuckle at how new the Old Catholic decor is: in imagery and candle lighting possibilities it’s reminiscent of the average Dutch Roman Catholic church. Its white walls and central heating tell me something different.

  • Read diary

My work

For the past 16 years, I've gained experience researching, designing, and building digital products and services. At present, I manage UX at Leeruniek, where we take a data-driven approach to equitable education. Having sharpened my pencils in both consumer and enterprise spaces, I now specialize in enterprise SaaS products and their services.

  • I add WD-40 to teams, habits, products, services, usually opting to repair before I disrupt
  • I solve business challenges by empathizing with users
  • I'm a strategic generalist, choosing my methods and modes based on the challenge at hand. Sometimes, lorem ipsum is fine.
  • I ask questions and question answers, and then repeat

I’ve been yelling at Internet clouds since 1997.

This website is a quiet street on the Internet where I come to learn in public, share my perspective, change my mind, and nurture my interests.

Born and raised in the Dutch South, I now live and work in Amsterdam. In its finest neighborhood, de Indische Buurt, I share a shoebox and a petit garden with Anja, and puppy Lemonade (who may or may not have a blog, let's find out together).

I'm a lifelong learner, an amateur musician, a curious home cook, a cautious Afropean queer Catholic, and a shameless urbanite. Currently you can find me diving head-first into minimalist compositions for the piano.
